definitions.definition: To enter into; to make way into the interior of; to pierce.
To achieve understanding of, despite some obstacle; to comprehend; to understand.
definitions.example: I could not penetrate Burke's opaque rhetoric.

definitions.definition: To affect profoundly through the senses or feelings; to move deeply.
definitions.example: to penetrate one's heart with pity

definitions.definition: To infiltrate an enemy to gather intelligence.
To insert the penis into an opening, such as a vagina or anus.
definitions.example: a male elephant comes up and penetrates the female elephant

definitions.definition: To move a piece past the defending pieces of one's opponent.

definitions.example: The skunk produces a penetrating odor.
His novel shows a penetrating insight into the criminal mind.
